abstract: A new study by Berkeley graduate students shows how widespread user tracking on the Web is, and how it conflicts with consumer expectations.
snippet: A new study by Berkeley graduate students shows how widespread user tracking on the Web is, and how it conflicts with consumer expectations.
lead_paragraph: Update | 11:57 a.m.  Clarifying in fifth paragraph that the study found the Google tracker on 88 percent of Web domains, not sites.

headline.main: Google Is Top Tracker of Surfers in Study
